subject: Economics
title: The Prisoner's Dilemma: Betrayal Is Rational
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Prisoner's Dilemma: Betrayal Is Rational.

hook.text: Two suspects are arrested. If both stay silent, they get 1 year each. If both confess, 5 years each.

buildup.text: Each prisoner reasons: if my partner stays silent, I should confess (0 vs. 1 year).

discovery.text: Both prisoners confess. Both get 5 years. If they'd cooperated, they'd have gotten 1 year each.

twist.text: The dilemma appears everywhere: arms races, climate change, overfishing.

climax.text: The Prisoner's Dilemma is the most important game in social science.

punchline.text: Two rational people, acting logically, produce the worst possible outcome for.
